post.description: Authorise a payment that was created with `authorisation_mode` set to `moto_api`.

400.description: Your request is invalid. Check the `code` and `description` in the response to find out why your request failed.

402.description: The `card_number` you sent is not a valid card number or you chose not to accept this card type. Check the `code` and `description` fields in the response to find out why your request failed.

422.description: A value you sent is invalid or missing. Check the `code` and `description` in the response to find out why your request failed.

500.description: There is something wrong with GOV.UK Pay. If there are no issues on our status page (https://payments.statuspage.io), you can contact us with your error code and we'll investigate.

get.description: Search disputes by status, 'from' and 'to' date, and 'from' and 'to' settled_date. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'

parameters.description: Returns disputes raised on or after the 'from_date' Date and time must be coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format to second-level accuracy - 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ'.
parameters.name: from_date

parameters.description: Returns disputes raised before the 'to_date' Date and time must be coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format to second-level accuracy - 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ'.
parameters.name: to_date

parameters.description: Returns disputes settled on or after the 'from_settled_date'. Date must be in ISO 8601 format to date-level accuracy - 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Disputes are settled when your payment service provider takes the disputed amount from a payout to your bank account.You can only use 'from_settled_date' to find disputes raised on or after 8 August 2022.
parameters.name: from_settled_date

parameters.description: Returns disputes settled before the 'to_settled_date'. 'Date must be in ISO 8601 format to date-level accuracy - 'YYYY-MM-DD'.Disputes are settled when your payment service provider takes the disputed amount from a payout to your bank account. You can only use 'to_settled_date' to find disputes raised on or after 8 August 2022.
parameters.name: to_settled_date

parameters.description: Returns disputes with a matching 'status'. 'status' reflects what stage of the dispute process a dispute is at.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Returns a specific page of results. Defaults to '1'.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of disputes returned per results page. Defaults to '500'. Maximum value is '500'
parameters.name: display_size

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

422.description: Invalid parameters: from_date, to_date, from_settled_date, to_settled_date, status, display_size. See Public API documentation for the correct data formats

get.description: Search payments by reference, state, 'from' and 'to' date. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'

parameters.description: Your payment reference to search (exact match, case insensitive)
parameters.name: reference

parameters.description: The user email used in the payment to be searched
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: State of payments to be searched. Example=success
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Card brand used for payment. Example=master-card
parameters.name: card_brand

parameters.description: From date of payments to be searched (this date is inclusive). Example=2015-08-13T12:35:00Z
parameters.name: from_date

parameters.description: To date of payments to be searched (this date is exclusive). Example=2015-08-14T12:35:00Z
parameters.name: to_date

parameters.description: Page number requested for the search, should be a positive integer (optional, defaults to 1)
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results to be shown per page, should be a positive integer (optional, defaults to 500, max 500)
parameters.name: display_size

parameters.description: Name on card used to make payment
parameters.name: cardholder_name

parameters.description: First six digits of the card used to make payment
parameters.name: first_digits_card_number

parameters.description: Last four digits of the card used to make payment
parameters.name: last_digits_card_number

parameters.description: From settled date of payment to be searched (this date is inclusive). Example=2015-08-13
parameters.name: from_settled_date

parameters.description: To settled date of payment to be searched (this date is inclusive). Example=2015-08-14
parameters.name: to_settled_date

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

422.description: Invalid parameters: from_date, to_date, status, display_size. See Public API documentation for the correct data formats

post.description: Create a new payment for the account associated to the Authorisation token. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

422.description: Invalid attribute value: description. Must be less than or equal to 255 characters length

get.description: Return information about the payment The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'

parameters.description: Payment identifier
parameters.name: paymentId

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

post.description: Cancel a payment based on the provided payment ID and the Authorisation token. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'. A payment can only be cancelled if it's in a state that isn't finished.

parameters.description: Payment identifier
parameters.name: paymentId

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

post.description: Capture a payment based on the provided payment ID and the Authorisation token. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'. A payment can only be captured if it's in 'submitted' state

parameters.description: Payment identifier
parameters.name: paymentId

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

get.description: Return payment events information about a certain payment The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'

parameters.description: Payment identifier
parameters.name: paymentId

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

get.description: Return refunds for a payment. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'
get.operationId: Get all refunds for a payment

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

get.summary: Get all refunds for a payment

post.description: Return issued refund information. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'
post.operationId: Submit a refund for a payment

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

post.summary: Submit a refund for a payment

get.description: Return payment refund information by Refund ID The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

get.description: Search refunds by 'from' and 'to' date. The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'authorization' header as 'authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE'

parameters.description: From date of refunds to be searched (this date is inclusive). Example=2015-08-13T12:35:00Z
parameters.name: from_date

parameters.description: To date of refunds to be searched (this date is exclusive). Example=2015-08-14T12:35:00Z
parameters.name: to_date

parameters.description: From settled date of refund to be searched (this date is inclusive). Example=2015-08-13
parameters.name: from_settled_date

parameters.description: To settled date of refund to be searched (this date is inclusive). Example=2015-08-13
parameters.name: to_settled_date

parameters.description: Page number requested for the search, should be a positive integer (optional, defaults to 1)
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results to be shown per page, should be a positive integer (optional, defaults to 500, max 500)
parameters.name: display_size

401.description: Credentials are required to access this resource

422.description: Invalid parameters. See Public API documentation for the correct data formats

Address.description: A structure representing the billing address of a card

AuthorisationRequest.description: Contains the user's payment information. This information will be sent to the payment service provider to authorise the payment.

card_number.description: The full card number from the paying user's card.

cardholder_name.description: The name on the paying user's card.

cvc.description: The card verification code (CVC) or card verification value (CVV) on the paying user's card.

expiry_date.description: The expiry date of the paying user's card. This value must be in `MM/YY` format.

one_time_token.description: This single use token authorises your request and matches it to a payment. GOV.UK Pay generated the `one_time_token` when the payment was created.

AuthorisationSummary.description: Object containing information about the authentication of the payment.

CardDetails.description: A structure representing the payment card

card_type.description: The card type, `debit` or `credit` or `null` if not able to determine

expiry_date.description: The expiry date of the card in MM/yy format

language.description: ISO-639-1 Alpha-2 code of a supported language to use on the payment pages

moto.description: Mail Order / Telephone Order (MOTO) payment flag

created_date.description: The date you created the payment.

description.description: The human-readable description you gave the payment.

email.description: The email address of your user.

language.description: Which language your users will see on the payment pages when they make a payment.

moto.description: Mail Order / Telephone Order (MOTO) payment flag.

payment_id.description: The unique identifier of the payment.

provider_id.description: The reference number the payment gateway associated with the payment.

reference.description: The reference number you associated with this payment.

return_url.description: An HTTPS URL on your site that your user will be sent back to once they have completed their payment attempt on GOV.UK Pay.

DisputeDetailForSearch.description: Contains disputes matching your search criteria.

created_date.description: The date and time the user's bank told GOV.UK Pay about this dispute.

dispute_id.description: The unique ID GOV.UK Pay automatically associated with this dispute when the paying user disputed the payment.

evidence_due_date.description: The deadline for submitting your supporting evidence. This value uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and ISO 8601 format

fee.description: The payment service provider’s dispute fee, in pence.

net_amount.description: The amount, in pence, your payment service provider will take for a lost dispute. 'net_amount' is deducted from your payout after you lose the dispute. For example, a 'net_amount' of '-1500' means your PSP will take £15.00 from your next payout into your bank account. 'net_amount' is always a negative value. 'net_amount' only appears if you lose the dispute.

payment_id.description: The unique ID GOV.UK Pay automatically associated with this payment when you created it.

reason.description: The reason the paying user gave for disputing this payment. Possible values are: 'credit_not_processed', 'duplicate', 'fraudulent', 'general', 'product_not_received', 'product_unacceptable', 'unrecognised', 'subscription_cancelled', >'other'

status.description: The current status of the dispute. Possible values are: 'needs_response', 'won', 'lost', 'under_review'

count.description: Number of disputes on the current page of search results.

page.description: The page of results you’re viewing. To view other pages, make this request again using the 'page' parameter.

results.description: Contains disputes matching your search criteria.

total.description: Number of total disputes matching your search criteria.

authorisation_mode.description: How the payment will be authorised. Payments created in `web` mode require the paying user to visit the `next_url` to complete the payment.

card_brand.description: Card Brand. Deprecated, please use card_details.card_brand instead

fee.description: processing fee taken by the GOV.UK Pay platform, in pence. Only available depending on payment service provider

moto.description: Mail Order / Telephone Order (MOTO) payment flag

net_amount.description: amount including all surcharges and less all fees, in pence. Only available depending on payment service provider

Link.description: A link related to a payment

authorisation_mode.description: How the payment will be authorised. Payments created in `web` mode require the paying user to visit the `next_url` to complete the payment.

card_brand.description: Card Brand. Deprecated, please use card_details.card_brand instead

fee.description: processing fee taken by the GOV.UK Pay platform, in pence. Only available depending on payment service provider

moto.description: Mail Order / Telephone Order (MOTO) payment flag

net_amount.description: amount including all surcharges and less all fees, in pence. Only available depending on payment service provider

PaymentEvent.description: A List of Payment Events information

PaymentEventLink.description: Resource link for a payment of a payment event

PaymentEvents.description: A List of Payment Events information

amount.description: Amount in pence. Can't be more than the available amount for refunds

refund_amount_available.description: Amount in pence. Total amount still available before issuing the refund

PaymentSettlementSummary.description: A structure representing information about a settlement

capture_submit_time.description: Date and time capture request has been submitted. May be null if capture request was not immediately acknowledged by payment gateway.

settled_date.description: The date that the transaction was paid into the service's account.

PaymentState.description: A structure representing the current state of the payment in its lifecycle.

code.description: What went wrong with the Payment if it finished with an error - error code

message.description: What went wrong with the Payment if it finished with an error - English message

status.description: Current progress of the payment in its lifecycle

PostLink.description: A POST link related to a payment

example.description: This is a value for a parameter called description
This is a value for a parameter called description

RefundSettlementSummary.description: A structure representing information about a settlement for refunds

settled_date.description: The date that the transaction was refunded from the service's account.

RefundSummary.description: A structure representing the refunds availability

amount_available.description: Amount available for refund in pence

amount_submitted.description: Amount submitted for refunds on this Payment in pence

description.example: Invalid attribute value: amount. Must be less than or equal to 10000000

SettlementSummary.description: Contains information about when a lost dispute was settled. A dispute is settled when your payment service provider takes it from a payout to your bank account. 'settlement_summary' only appears if you lost the dispute.

settled_date.description: The date your payment service provider took the disputed payment and dispute fee from a payout to your bank account. This value appears in ISO 8601 format. 'settled_date' only appears if you lost the dispute.

ThreeDSecure.description: Object containing information about the 3D Secure authentication of the payment.

required.description: Flag indicating whether the payment required 3D Secure authentication.

BearerAuth.description: The Authorisation token needs to be specified in the 'Authorization' header as `Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE`
